2/27/2015 5:11:56 PM
Our dependence on computers has increased tremendously. Right from running a school to a railway system or an aeroplane, we are depepndent on computers. Do you think, our lives are going to become more dependent on computers as technology advances? Is this dependence good for our overall development? Give reason.

                  YES, I AGREE THAT WE ARE DEPENDENT ON COMPUTERS DAY BY DAY. AS THE TECHNOLOGICAL ADVANCES ARE MORE IN PRESENT SCENORIO LIKE ONLINE BUSINESS , ONLINE SHOPPING, ONLINE PAYMENTS ETC. EVEN WE CAN WORK FROM ANY WHERE IN THE WORLD AND AT ANY TIME. NOW A DAYS EVEN KIDS ARE LEARNING FROM IT. THERE IS A EXTREME CHANGE IN USING COMPUTERS. WHAT EVER IT MIGHT BE WITHIN FRACTION OF SECONDS WE CAN GET THE INFORMATION. THEY ARE MANY ADVANTAGES USING COMPUTERS SUCH AS WE CAN VIDEO CHAT WITH OUR BELOVED ONES, AT ANY TIME WE CAN GET THE INFORMATION FROM COMPUTER , WE CAN PLAY GAMES ,  WE CAN USE DOCUMENTS TO SAVE THE DATA AS SIMPLE AS THAT WE CAN SAVE OUR MEMORIES IN IT . IT LOOKS LIKE A MACHINE BUT IT IS MORE POWERFUL THAN THE HUMAN BRAIN. NOW A DAY COMPUTERS ARE ACTING AS IMPORTANT ELECTRONIC PRODUCT EACH AND EVERY ARE USING IT. 

IT IS PLAYING A PROMINENT ROLE IN COMPETITIVE EXAMS. IN EACH AND EVERY  FIELD COMPUTERS ARE PLAYS A MAJOR ROLE .FOR EXAMPLES WE A GET INFROMATION OR DATA AFTER FEW YEARS.EVEN IN HOSPITALS,SCHOOLS,FOR ANY BUSINESS PURPOSE.THERE IS A TREMENDOUS CHANGE IN HUMAN DAY TO DAY LIFE  EVEN THOUGH IT HAS SOME DISADVANTAGES BUT THERE ARE MANY ADVANTAGES TO OVERCOME.

IN THIS COMPETITIVE WORLD COMPUTERS ARE MAJOR PART OF HUMANS LIFE. IF WE DONT KNOW ANY ROUTE OR LOCATION WE CAN SEARCH IN COMPUTERS. THERE ARE MANY GAMES WHICH WE CAN GAIN CONCENTRATION , WE CAN SAVE PHOTES IN COMPUTERS, WE CAN LISEN SONGS, WE CAN SEE THE NEWS , MOVIES. IT IS  MORE USEFUL PRODUCT WHERE THERE IS NO TARGET UERS EVERY AGE PERSON CAN USE IT FOR THERE REQUIREMENTS. WE CAN DO INTERNATIONAL BUSINESS USING IT.   FOR OVERALL DEVELOPMENTS IN WORLD COMPUTERS ARE PLAYING A MAJOR ROLE.  

File Name:June2013GlobalAutoIndustryOutlook

THE AUTO INDUSTRY IN U.S. ARE VERY CONCENTRATING TO DEVELOP AND SOME OF COMPANIES PRODUCING 80% AND FROM THAT 90%  VECHICLES SOLD. IN 2013 AMNY OF THE TOP COMPANIES ARE LEDDING WITH MARKET SHARES WITHIN FEW MONTHS . FROM GENERAL MOTORS TOYOTA RECAPTURED IT SALES BY SELLING 9.75 MILLION VEHICLES IN 2012 GLOBALLY.VLKAY CAME THIRD WITH THE SALES IN THAT YEAR.TO NGAIN COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGES THE COMPANIES MUST REDESIN THE VEHICLES TO ATTRACT THE CUSTOMERS IN BOTH MATURE AND EMERGING MARKETS WITH LEAST PRICE COMPARE WITH OTHER COMPETITIVE COMPANY  WITH THE BEST TECHNOLOGY  AND BY OFFERING ADDITIONAL FEATURES TO THE PRODUCT AND EVEN IF GET GET LOW PROFITS ALSO COMPANY SHOULD BARE IT IN ORDER TO ATTRACT THE BUYERS.

  AUTOMAKERS ARE CONCENTRATING TO OFFER ADDITIONAL AND OPTIONAL FEATURES TO IT. THEY ARE CONTINUE TO SHIFT THEIR PRODUCTS FROM HIGH LEVEL ARES TO LOW LEVEL AREAS BECAUSE MORE THAN HALF PRECENTAGE OF GROWTH IN VEHICLE PRODUCTION IN THE AUTO INDUSTRY FROM LAST FEW YEARS. IN MOLDING THE AUTO INDUSTRY  GOVERNMENT ARE PLAYING A MAJOR ROLE AND THEIR ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL POLICES ARE STRONG.

  THE MAJOR AUTOMAKES S, INCLUDING FORD, GM ,HONDA, KIA AND OTHER COMPANIES SIGNED LETTERS OF COMMITMENT WITH U.S. TO UPGRADE THE FUEL ECONOMY TO 54.55 MKILES BY 2025.



#################--Don`t Delete below content#################

June 2013 – Global Auto Industry Outlook

The auto industry is highly concentrated. The top 10 global automakers account for roughly 80% of the worldwide production and nearly 90% of total vehicles sold in the U.S.

In the first five months of 2013, General Motors Company ( GM ) led with a 18.0% market share in the U.S., followed by Ford Motor Co. ( F ) with a 16.4% market share, Toyota Motors Corp. ( TM ) with a 14.2% market share, Chrysler-Fiat with a 11.7% market share, and Honda Motor Co. ( HMC ) and Nissan Motor Co. ( NSANY ) at the last spots with 9.5% and 8.1% market shares, respectively.

Toyota recaptured the sales crown from General Motors by selling 9.75 million vehicles globally in 2012, which exceeded GM`s sales of 9.29 million vehicles. Germany`s Volkswagen AG ( VLKAY ) came third with sales of 9.07 million vehicles for the year.

OPPORTUNITIES

To remain competitive, the automakers will need to design vehicles that will cater to consumers in both mature and emerging markets while manufacturing them at low-cost using the most advanced technology.

For example, Ford has undertaken "One Manufacturing" strategy, which aims at producing multiple models from plants across the world in order to save production costs and fast adaptation to changes in consumer tastes. The automaker anticipates producing 4.5 models at each of its plants by 2015, up from 3.6 models currently.

Further, the automakers are concentrating on offering more optional features (which will save money on gas), even on the small and less gas-guzzler vehicles in order to attract buyers. The sale of optional features is helping them offset lower profit margins for small cars relative to large trucks.

The automakers continue to shift their production facilities from high-cost regions such as North America and the European Union to lower-cost regions such as China, India and South America. According to a study by CSM Worldwide, China and South America together will represent more than 50% of growth in global light vehicle production in the auto industry from 2008 to 2015.

The role of governments is highly significant. Their energy and environmental policies will be strongly responsible in molding the auto industry in the coming years. In late 2011, 13 major automakers, including Ford, GM, Chrysler, BMW, Honda, Hyundai, Jaguar/Land Rover, Kia, Mazda, Mitsubishi, Nissan, Toyota and Volvo, have signed letters of commitment with the U.S. Government to upgrade the fuel economy standard of cars and light-duty trucks to 54.5 miles per gallon (mpg) by 2025.
